problem_statement: Write a Python code that takes a list of numbers and returns their sum
unit_tests:
def test_sum_function():
    assert sum_numbers([1, 2, 3, 4]) == 10
    assert sum_numbers([]) == 0
    assert sum_numbers([-1, 1]) == 0
    assert sum_numbers([5]) == 5
    assert sum_numbers([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) == 15
scoring_criteria:
Function correctly implemented: 40 points
Handles empty list: 20 points
Handles negative numbers: 20 points
Handles single element: 10 points
Handles multiple elements: 10 points
hints: Function name: sum_numbers. Parameter: numbers (list). Return: sum of all numbers in the list.

Correctly identifies largest: 50 points
Handles negative numbers: 30 points
Handles equal values: 20 points
hints: Function name: maxThree. Parameters: int a, int b, int c. Return: int (largest number).

problem_statement: Write a C++ function that calculates the sum of numbers from 1 to n
scoring_criteria:
Correct loop implementation: 50 points
Handles 0: 30 points
Handles small numbers: 20 points
hints: Function name: sumToN. Parameter: int n. Return: int (sum from 1 to n).

problem_statement: Write a C++ function that finds the minimum element in a vector of integers
scoring_criteria:
Correct minimum logic: 60 points
Handles negatives and single element: 40 points
hints: Function name: findMin. Parameter: std::vector<int> v. Return: int (smallest number).

problem_statement: Write a C++ function that checks if a string is a palindrome
scoring_criteria:
Correct palindrome logic: 60 points
Handles edge cases: 40 points
hints: Function name: isPalindrome. Parameter: std::string text. Return: bool (true if palindrome).

problem_statement: Write a Java method that checks if a number is even or odd. Return true for even, false for odd.
scoring_criteria:
Correctly identifies even numbers: 40 points
Correctly identifies odd numbers: 40 points
Handles zero and negatives: 20 points
hints: Method name: isEven. Parameter: int num. Return: boolean (true for even, false for odd).

problem_statement: Write a Java method that returns the maximum of two integers
scoring_criteria:
Handles greater number correctly: 50 points
Handles negative numbers: 30 points
Handles equality: 20 points
hints: Method name: maxTwo. Parameters: int a, int b. Return: int (larger number).

problem_statement: Write a Java method that calculates the factorial of a non-negative integer
scoring_criteria:
Correctly computes factorial: 60 points
Handles 0 and 1: 40 points
hints: Method name: factorial. Parameter: int n. Return: int (factorial of n).

problem_statement: Write a Java method that counts the number of even numbers in an integer array
scoring_criteria:
Correctly counts evens: 50 points
Handles empty array: 30 points
Handles all odd: 20 points
hints: Method name: countEven. Parameter: int[] arr. Return: int (count of even numbers).

scoring_criteria:

hints: Method name: isPrime. Parameter: int num. Return: boolean (true if prime).

problem_statement: Write a C function that determines the grade based on score (A: 90+, B: 80-89, C: 70-79, D: 60-69, F: <60)
scoring_criteria:
Correct grade logic: 50 points
Handles all grade ranges: 30 points
Edge cases: 20 points
hints: Function name: getGrade. Parameter: int score. Return: char* (grade letter).

Correct reversal: 60 points

unit_tests: Function name: reverseString. Parameter: char* str. Return: void (modifies string in place).
